data.text: A visual representation or image painted, drawn, photographed, or otherwise rendered on a flat surface.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A visible image, especially one on a flat surface or screen.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: the picture reflected in the lake; focused the picture on the movie screen.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A vivid or realistic verbal description.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A person or object bearing a marked resemblance to another.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: She's the picture of her mother.

data.text: A person, object, or scene that typifies or embodies an emotion, state of mind, or mood.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: Your face was the very picture of horror.

data.text: The chief circumstances of an event or time; the situation.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: How does the new boyfriend figure in the picture?

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
